tool.name: Scanpy FilterCells
tool.description: based on counts and numbers of genes expressed
tool.command: ln -s '${input_obj_file}' input.h5 && PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 scanpy-filter-cells #if $gene_name --gene-name '${gene_name}' #end if #if $parameters #set pars = ' '.join(['--param {name} {min} {max}'.format(**$p) for $p in $parameters]) ${pars} #end if #if $categories #set cats = ' '.join(['--category {name} {values}'.format(**$c) for $c in $categories]) ${cats} #end if #if $subsets #set subs = ' '.join(['--subsets {name} {subset}'.format(**$s) for $c in $subsets]) ${subs} #end if @INPUT_OPTS@ @OUTPUT_OPTS@

param.name: gene_name
param.label: Name of the column in `anndata.var` that contains gene name
param.help: This is used for flagging mitochondria genes

param.name: name
param.label: Name of parameter to filter on

param.name: name
param.label: Name of the categorical variable to filter on

param.name: name
param.label: Name of the categorical variable to filter on
